text: Inhibition of NF-kappaB signaling in cpdm BMDC .
WT and cpdm BMDC ( 2x106 cells in 0.5 mL complete medium ) were stimulated with 100 ng / mL LPS ( A ) or 25 microg / mL poly I : C ( B ) .

At 0 , 15 , 30 , and 60 minutes , whole-cell lysates were obtained and subject to immunoblots with antibodies against proteins involved in NF-kappaB , <extra_id_0> TBK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> IRF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> ERK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and p38 signaling pathways .
<extra_id_0> Beta-actin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was used as loading control .

( C ) Cellular levels of p - <extra_id_0> IKK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and p - <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in LPS - or poly I : C - stimulated BMDC were quantitated with ImageJ ( NIH ) and presented as trend lines .
Results are representative of at least two independent experiments .
